crime_fact:
Crime Facts

The defendants are internal directors of Company E located in C, D-dong, Gijang-gun, Busan (the company name was changed to Company F around June 4, 2020), and the victim G is the representative of a limited company I, which is engaged in the construction business in H, Mokpo city. Defendant A, knowing that Company E was struggling financially and also experiencing personal financial difficulties due to personal debts, proposed to Defendant B, who was close to the victim, to borrow money from the victim under the pretext that the company urgently needed funds for construction. Defendant B, also burdened with personal debts borrowed from acquaintances, agreed to Defendant A's proposal to conspire together to embezzle funds from the victim.

Subsequently, around mid-February 2020, Defendant B proposed to the victim, "Can you subcontract and complete the construction of a 2,000 pyeong (approx. 6,611 square meters) new factory building project in Hamyang-gun, ordered by Company J, from Company E?" When the victim visited the construction site in Hamyang-gun but decided not to contract due to a shortage of steel materials, the defendants at the site persuaded the victim to sign the contract by saying, "We will adjust and provide the lacking materials later." Eventually, the victim contracted to subcontract the steel structure construction of the new factory in Hamyang-gun ordered by Company J from Company E, with a total construction cost of 957 million won, an advance payment of 190 million won, and a construction period from March 2, 2020, to July 31, 2020.

Upon the victim entering into the subcontract agreement, the defendants immediately lied to the victim, saying, "Our company urgently needs money for another construction site, so if you receive the advance payment of 190 million won, please lend us 150 million won. Our company has enough money, so we can repay it at any time. We will definitely repay it within two months at the latest." However, the defendants had no intention or ability to repay the borrowed money to the victim, as they planned to use the funds for their personal debt repayment rather than for Company E's other construction sites. They had personal debts of tens of millions of won borrowed from acquaintances, and with Company E's deteriorating management, there was no significant income.

Despite this, the defendants deceived the victim and received a total of 150 million won, including 100 million won around March 5, 2020, and 50 million won around March 6, 2020, into Defendant B's K Bank account from the victim who was tricked by their deceit.

Thus, the defendants conspired to receive property from the victim.

target_node.label: W_12
target_node.text: The defendant, as a joint and several debtor of the loan to the victim, drafting a notarized loan contract demonstrates a clear intent to deceive the victim in order to borrow money.

target_reason: The guarantee of w00012 points out the weakness in the claim that the defendant attempted to take out a loan, but this guarantee is based on too broad assumptions without any specific information about the defendant's property or income status. The claim that "it is realistically impossible to take out a large loan without any property or income" does not apply to all cases, especially without considering specific circumstances such as the lending criteria of financial institutions or the credit status of the defendant. Therefore, this guarantee is considered weak in terms of logical connection in reflecting the actual intent of the defendant and lacks direct relevance to the criminal facts. For these reasons, w00012 is considered a weak guarantee.

nodes.label: MC_01
nodes.text: The defendant was in financial difficulty, but this does not mean that there was no intention or ability to repay the loan, and the error in the sales slip presented to the victim shows that there was no intent to deceive.

nodes.label: MC_01
nodes.text: The defendant defrauded the victim of money and clearly deceived the victim by presenting false statements and incorrect sales slips, causing the victim to suffer financial loss. Such actions are sufficient to prove the defendant's guilt.

nodes.label: C_01
nodes.text: The defendant had no intention of deceiving the victim.

nodes.label: W_01
nodes.text: The sales slip presented by the defendant was a cash sales slip, and this could be due to a simple mistake, making it difficult to view as an act intended to deceive.

nodes.label: D_01
nodes.text: The point that the sales slip presented by the defendant was a cash sales slip

nodes.label: C_02
nodes.text: The defendant had the intention and ability to repay the loan.

nodes.label: W_02
nodes.text: The defendant was in financial difficulty, but this does not mean that he had no intention or ability to repay the loan.

nodes.label: D_02
nodes.text: The defendant, who was running a pub and a restaurant as a joint business without much other property, was in arrears with wages due to business difficulties. However, this does not directly prove the absence of intent or ability to pay.

nodes.label: C_03
nodes.text: Due to the lack of sufficient evidence, the defendant cannot be conclusively determined to have had the intent to deceive.

nodes.label: W_03
nodes.text: The defendant acknowledges borrowing money from the victim, but there is insufficient evidence to conclusively determine that the action was carried out with the intent to deceive.

nodes.label: D_03
nodes.text: The defendant can acknowledge the fact that they borrowed money from the victim, but argue that it was not done with the intention to deceive.

nodes.label: C_04
nodes.text: The defendant deceived the victim into taking out a loan and committed fraud in the process of borrowing the money.

nodes.label: W_04
nodes.text: The process of inducing the victim to take out a loan and then having that money transferred to oneself is a premeditated act by the defendant to deceive the victim and gain financial benefit.

nodes.label: D_04
nodes.text: The defendant lied to the victim, saying, "If you, as the owner of the 'C' bar, apply for and receive a loan of 30 million won from (Limited) G and 5 million won from H, and give that loan to me, I will definitely repay that debt." Consequently, the victim, deceived by this, transferred the loan money to the defendant.

nodes.label: C_05
nodes.text: The defendant clearly intended to deceive the victim in order to cause financial loss.

nodes.label: W_05
nodes.text: The fact that the defendant planned to have the victim transfer the loan money to him, thereby causing the victim financial loss, demonstrates that this was part of the defendant's calculated actions.

nodes.label: D_05
nodes.text: The defendant, having no significant assets and facing difficulties in operating businesses such as bars and restaurants, was in arrears with wages. This indicates that the defendant had neither the intention nor the ability to repay the loans on time.

nodes.label: C_06
nodes.text: The defendant committed an act of deception by lying to the victim and providing false information.

nodes.label: W_06
nodes.text: The victim's act of transferring the loan due to being deceived by the defendant's lies and provision of false information is the result of the defendant's premeditated act of fraud.

nodes.label: D_06
nodes.text: The defendant lied to the victim, saying, "If you apply for a 5 million won youth startup loan from the Credit Guarantee Foundation, get the guarantee, and then apply for a loan from J Bank, and give me the loan amount, I will definitely repay that debt." Consequently, the defendant made the victim transfer the amount borrowed from J Bank.

nodes.label: C_07
nodes.text: The act of the victim transferring the loan to the defendant shows that it was a decision based on the trust relationship between the victim and the defendant, not the result of the defendant's premeditated deceitful actions.

nodes.label: W_07
nodes.text: There was a certain trust relationship between the victim and the defendant, and this can be seen as the main reason why the victim transferred the loan at the request of the defendant.

nodes.label: D_07
nodes.text: The defendant, around October 14, 2019, borrowed the name of the victim B to actually operate a bar named 'C', which suggests a trust relationship previously established between the two parties.

nodes.label: C_08
nodes.text: The defendant was in financial difficulty, but this does not mean that the defendant had no intention or ability to repay the loan.

nodes.label: W_08
nodes.text: Even if one encounters economic difficulties, this does not prove a complete lack of potential repayment ability, but suggests that it may be a temporary liquidity problem.

nodes.label: D_08
nodes.text: The fact is that the defendant, having no significant assets and facing difficulties in operating businesses such as a pub and a restaurant in partnership, was in arrears with wages. However, this does not mean that the defendant had no intention or ability to pay at all.

nodes.label: C_09
nodes.text: The mistake in the sales slip presented to the victim shows that there was no intent to deceive.

nodes.label: W_09
nodes.text: The fact that the sales slips presented by the defendant were cash sales slips could be due to a simple mistake, and this cannot be conclusively determined as an act intended to deceive.

nodes.label: D_09
nodes.text: The defendant can admit to having borrowed money from the victim but argue that it was not done with the intention to deceive.

nodes.label: C_10
nodes.text: The defendant intentionally deceived the victim to embezzle money.

nodes.label: W_10
nodes.text: The act of the defendant lying to the victim to take out a loan and then transferring that money to their own account can be seen as a premeditated act of deception.

nodes.label: D_10
nodes.text: Around October 17, 2019, the victim transferred 29.8 million won out of the 30 million won liquor loan received from '(Limited) G' into an account under the defendant's name.

nodes.label: C_11
nodes.text: The defendant caused the victim to take out a loan despite having no intention or ability to repay it.

nodes.label: W_11
nodes.text: Despite the defendant being without assets and struggling in business, leading to unpaid wages, the act of making the victim take out a loan and borrow that money is a clear act of deception.

nodes.label: D_11
nodes.text: In fact, the defendant, having hardly any assets and facing difficulties in the operation of businesses such as a pub and a restaurant run in partnership, was in arrears with wages and struggled to secure operating expenses. Thus, it is evident that the defendant had neither the intention nor the ability to repay in a timely manner, even if they borrowed money by causing the victim to take out a loan.

nodes.label: C_12
nodes.text: The defendant acted with premeditation to cause financial harm to the victim.

nodes.label: W_12
nodes.text: The defendant, as a joint and several debtor of the loan to the victim, drafting a notarized loan contract demonstrates a clear intent to deceive the victim in order to borrow money.

nodes.label: D_12
nodes.text: The defendant and C jointly created a notarized document for a loan agreement as joint and several debtors for the victim's loan.

nodes.label: C_13
nodes.text: The defendant's act of causing the victim to take out a loan is clearly intended to deceive.

nodes.label: W_13
nodes.text: The act of lying to the victim to obtain a loan and then having the money transferred to oneself can be seen as a premeditated and intentional act of deception.

nodes.label: D_13
nodes.text: Around October 16, 2019, the defendant, who was operating a restaurant named 'F' located in Seo-gu, Gwangju, lied to the victim, promising that if the victim applied for and received a loan of 30 million won for alcohol from E and 5 million won from H, and then gave the loan money to the defendant, the defendant would undoubtedly repay the debt.

nodes.label: C_14
nodes.text: The defendant, despite having no intention or ability to repay, caused the victim to take out a loan, thereby inflicting financial damage.

nodes.label: W_14
nodes.text: In a situation where there is no property and business is difficult, causing wage arrears, the act of deceiving the victim into taking out a loan clearly indicates an intention to inflict financial damage on the victim.

nodes.label: D_14
nodes.text: The defendant, in fact, had no significant assets and was struggling to operate businesses such as a pub and a restaurant in partnership, resulting in unpaid wages due to difficulties in securing operational funds. Consequently, the defendant had neither the intention nor the ability to repay the money on time, even if it meant having the victim take out a loan to lend him the money.

nodes.label: C_15
nodes.text: The defendant systematically deceived the victim to embezzle funds.

nodes.label: W_15
nodes.text: The act of repeatedly lying to the victim to take out a loan and then transferring that loan money to one's own account can be seen as a planned and intentional deception.

nodes.label: D_15
nodes.text: Around October 17, 2019, the victim received 29.8 million won out of 30 million won from a so-called liquor loan from '(Limited) G' transferred to an account under the name of I, and around October 18, 2019, 5 million won borrowed from H was transferred to an unknown account. Subsequently, around November 4, 2019, from an unspecified location in Gwangju, the victim received a call stating, "If you apply for a youth startup loan of 5 million won from the Credit Guarantee Foundation and get a guarantee certificate, then apply for a loan at J Bank and give me the loan money you receive, I will definitely repay that debt," which was a lie. Believing this, the victim, at the same time and place, used the 5 million won borrowed from J Bank to offset the unpaid wages the defendant owed the victim and the credit card charges the victim incurred, and the remaining 219,420 won was transferred to the defendant's account.

nodes.label: C_16
nodes.text: The mistake in the sales slip presented by the defendant to the victim shows that there was no intent to deceive.

nodes.label: W_16
nodes.text: The fact that the sales slip presented to the victim was a cash sales slip can be seen as a simple mistake, and it is far from intentional deception.

nodes.label: D_16
nodes.text: The fact that the sales slip presented by the defendant was a cash sales slip

nodes.label: C_17
nodes.text: Even if the defendant was in a financially difficult situation, this does not mean that there was absolutely no intention or ability to repay the loan.

nodes.label: W_17
nodes.text:
ENGLISH OUTPUT 
Just because one is in financial difficulty does not automatically mean that they lack the intention or ability to make payments, and such situations can happen to anyone.

nodes.label: D_17
nodes.text: The defendant, without any significant assets and facing difficulties in operating businesses such as a pub and a restaurant in partnership, was in arrears with wage payments.

nodes.label: C_18
nodes.text: The fact that the defendant and C jointly created a notarized loan agreement as joint and several debtors for the borrowed money from the victim shows their intention to repay.

nodes.label: W_18
nodes.text: The act of drafting a fair document for a loan contract as a joint debtor is strong evidence of having the intention to repay, and this contradicts actions aimed at deceit.

nodes.label: D_18
nodes.text: The defendant and C jointly created a notarized document for a loan agreement as joint and several debtors for the victim's loan.
